page.title: 05SCHOOLS
page.content: There are two former schools in the area, Maidenwell and Burwell. In 1973 Maidenwell school was turned in to an outdoor pursuits centre, still in the care of Lincolnshire Education Authority. It was just one big room, but two sleeping galleries and modern kitchen facilities have been added. At one time water was taken from a water butt. Now drinking water has to be taken in containers. It is run by a special school in Louth, but is open for bookings by special schools throughout the country. Burwell school closed around the same time and became part of a garage/filling station which has also closed recently. Children in the area now travel to Louth to school.
